benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/tags - Retrieve account tags

covered: Acceptance criteria (200 + JSON array of Tag objects, includedDeleted default/true, audit default/VALUES) are covered by TC01-TC06 (happy path, includedDeleted, audit=FULL/MINIMAL, empty response).
Query parameter handling: valid and invalid audit values, includedDeleted behavior, unknown query params, and some injection/XSS handling are tested (TC02-TC05, TC09-TC10, TC15).
Path parameter validation & error responses: non-existent account (404), invalid formats and partial/empty/whitespace UUIDs, and SQL-injection attempt are covered (TC07, TC08, TC14, TC20-TC22).
Authentication negatives: missing and invalid authentication token scenarios are included (TC12, TC13).
Security, resilience & integration: SQL injection/XSS tests, API down and downstream error handling, data consistency and regression checks are present (TC11, TC14, TC15, TC18, TC24, TC25).
Performance & concurrency: large dataset and concurrent request tests exist (TC16, TC17) with response-time expectations.
gaps: Pagination: There are no tests for pagination/limit/offset behavior or server behavior when results are large and pagination is expected or absent.
Caching behavior: No tests assert Cache-Control/ETag/Last-Modified headers or conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match / 304).
Rate limiting / throttling: No tests for 429 responses / Retry-After when many requests are submitted rapidly; TC17 covers concurrency but not throttling/rate-limits.

Schema / contract validation: "JSON array of Tag objects" is asserted semantically but tests do not validate Tag object schema (required fields, types, nested audit structure) nor standardized error response schema.
Authorization scope (403): Tests cover missing/invalid tokens (401) but do not cover authenticated-but-unauthorized (403) or role/permission-based access control.
Headers & content negotiation: Content-Type is asserted only once (TC01); other success/error responses and Accept header handling aren’t validated for consistency.

Large-result handling strategy: TC16 expects returning 10,000 items in one response but there are no tests for server-side limits, streaming/pagination fallbacks, or graceful failures (413, chunking behavior).
recommendations: Add pagination tests (limit/offset/page) if the API supports it; if not supported, document behavior and add tests that assert consistent behavior on large result sets and boundaries.
Add caching tests: assert Cache-Control and ETag headers; test conditional GET (If-None-Match) and expect 304 when appropriate.
Add rate-limiting tests: generate bursts of requests to assert 429 and Retry-After behavior; include these as automated load tests in CI/performance pipeline.

Introduce strict JSON schema/contract validation for Tag objects and error responses (JSON Schema or contract tests) and assert field presence/types (including audit structure) across success and error cases.
Expand authorization tests to cover 403 Forbidden scenarios (valid token but insufficient permissions), expired tokens, and scope-based access.
Assert Content-Type and other relevant headers for all success and error paths; add Accept header/content-negotiation tests.
Define expected server behavior for very large responses (streaming, pagination, limit errors) and add tests for server limits and graceful failures instead of assuming the server returns all items.
Automate these additions (schema checks, caching, rate-limiting, and load tests) and integrate into CI to prevent regressions and ensure contract stability.
